description: Primes of form 6k+5 generated recursively: a(1)=5; a(n)=Min{p, prime; Mod[p,6]=5; p|6Q-1}, where Q is the product of all previous terms in the sequence.
references: Dirichlet,P.G.L (1871): Vorlesungen uber Zahlentheorie. Braunschweig, Viewig, Supplement VI, 24 pages.
G. H. Hardy and E. M. Wright, An Introduction to the Theory of Numbers. 3rd ed., Oxford Univ. Press, 1954, page 13.
links: Robert Price, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..17
example: a(3)=11 is the smallest prime divisor of the form 6k+5 of 6*(5.29)-1 = 6Q-1 = 11.79 = 869.
author: _Labos Elemer_, Oct 09 2000
